natural solution: We first substitute $x$ in the given expression to obtain  $$\sqrt{x^2}-3=\sqrt{6^2}-3.$$Next, we apply the order of operations to get \begin{align} \sqrt{6^2}-3&=\sqrt{36}-3 \\&=6-3 \\&=\boxed{3}. \end{align}Note: Squaring and square rooting are inverse operations, so $\sqrt{x^2} = x$ for nonnegative numbers $x$.
